data.text: Schwalbe Maraton versus Continental Contact Plus for Bicycle Touring?
Hi, can someone compare Schwalbe Maraton with Continental Contact Plus? I am curious about rolling resistance and flat tyre protection.
No comparison. Schwalbe Marathon Plus and Mondials are far better than Continental.
data.author: Javier ColÃ³n

data.text: Schwalbe marathon plus lasted me 40,000km with one or two flat tyre. Continental contact plus 10 flats at least, rubber cracking, sidewall peeling, in the end I throw them in garbage after 5,000km. Get schwalbe

data.text: I am a dedicate Maraton Mondial user but could not buy them during the pandemic. So went with Continental. Nor this model but haven't had flats do far..

data.text: Schwalbe mondials lasted me about 3500miles and the whole trip butâ€¦â€¦Had about 25 flats as well. I will go with a lighter tubeless set up the next trip

data.text: where did you get 25 flats?
data.author: Travis M Hodgdon

data.text: mostly Wyoming, Utah, nebraska. Stickers(thorns)small wire from tires, few small staples, one long nail through the tread and the side wall. Did I mention thorns?
data.author: Jordan Schoonmaker

data.text: But take a look at OKO Bike sealants.For tubes and tubeless.www.oko.com
data.author: Graham Carmichael

data.text: Schwalbe are super puncture safe and super slow! Changed to tubeless and will never go back...
data.author: Fast Fuso

data.text: Twenty years ago I concluded Schwalbe and still use them, I traveled in Goathead thorn areas and could them off the tires without a flat.
data.author: Clyde Slade

data.text: Schwalbe Marathon 2000 miles 1 puncture so far. I even take them down flint and gravel tracks.
data.author: Nathan Rice-Smith

data.text: I crossed the US with marathon plus, more than 5000km and one puncture, most of my ride had thorns and broken beer bottles ðŸ˜‰
data.author: Steve Kennedy

data.text: They are heavy though
data.author: Steve Kennedy

data.author: Roman Pertzian

data.text: Marathon plus tour or BUST. Itâ€™s that simple.
data.author: Adam Oliver Harlow

data.text: Due to the difference in profile at maximum pressure, the Marathon has better rolling resistance. If you don't keep pressure at max, resistance will increase considerably.
data.author: Nick Perkins

data.text: On a duo bike trip right now, a flat tire of 2700 km with the Schwalbe Marathon, we are unconditional!!
data.author: JosÃ©e Pavy

data.text: 12,000 miles , 2 flat tires This says it all.
data.author: Philippe TÃ©trault

data.text: Using the Marathon Plus Tour (different tread to the Marathon Plus) I rode England to Singapore, on one pair, with one flat. (15,450 miles)
data.author: Mark Wallis

data.text: Marathon plus everytime.
data.author: Robert Duggan

data.text: I have used both and I have never had a flat on Schwalbe Marathon Plus in over 30 years. I have had several on Continental Contact Plus. Rolling resistance is less important to me
data.author: Michael Shireman

data.text: I do wish Schwalbe would up their 650B game, alas. There are no 650B options in the Plus Tours at all and only limited options in the other Marathon variants.
data.author: Justin Stephen
